intro: Andersonia echinocephala, commonly known as the spiny-headed Andersonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique spiky inflorescence and vibrant blooms make it a notable species in its native habitat. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
